document.discussion_title: Sensata Technologies Holding’s (ST) “Buy” Rating Reaffirmed at Bank of America
document.topic_text: Tweet Sensata Technologies Holding (NYSE:ST) ‘s stock had its “buy” rating reissued by Bank of America in a report issued on Monday, Analyst Ratings Net reports. Shares of Sensata Technologies Holding ( NYSE:ST ) traded down 1.217% during midday trading on Monday, reaching $37.755. The company had a trading volume of 1,208,080 shares. Sensata Technologies Holding has a 1-year low of $29.92 and a 1-year high of $55.53. The stock has a market capitalization of $6.43 billion and a PE ratio of 18.599. The company’s 50-day moving average is $37.49 and its 200-day moving average is $40.81. Sensata Technologies Holding (NYSE:ST) last released its quarterly earnings data on Tuesday, February 2nd. The company reported $0.66 EPS for the quarter, beating analysts’ consensus estimates of $0.65 by $0.01. The business earned $726.50 million during the quarter, compared to analyst estimates of $722.45 million. The company’s revenue was up 3.0% on a year-over-year basis. During the same quarter in the prior year, the company posted $0.57 earnings per share. On average, equities research analysts forecast that Sensata Technologies Holding will post $2.86 EPS for the current year. Other institutional investors have bought and sold shares of the company. OLD National Bancorp IN raised its position in Sensata Technologies Holding by 2.1% in the first quarter. OLD National Bancorp IN now owns 6,867 shares of the company’s stock valued at $267,000 after buying an additional 143 shares during the period. Fox Run Management L.L.C. acquired a new position in Sensata Technologies Holding during the first quarter valued at approximately $330,000. US Bancorp DE raised its position in Sensata Technologies Holding by 6.1% in the fourth quarter. US Bancorp DE now owns 22,960 shares of the company’s stock valued at $1,057,000 after buying an additional 1,317 shares during the period. Sawtooth Asset Management Inc. raised its position in Sensata Technologies Holding by 15,004.2% in the fourth quarter. Sawtooth Asset Management Inc. now owns 25,224 shares of the company’s stock valued at $1,162,000 after buying an additional 25,057 shares during the period. Finally, Andra AP fonden raised its position in Sensata Technologies Holding by 40.4% in the fourth quarter. Andra AP fonden now owns 28,500 shares of the company’s stock valued at $1,313,000 after buying an additional 8,200 shares during the period. Other research analysts have also recently issued reports about the company. Zacks Investment Research upgraded Sensata Technologies Holding from a “sell” rating to a “hold” rating in a report on Wednesday, April 6th. Barclays decreased their price objective on Sensata Technologies Holding from $50.00 to $47.00 and set an “overweight” rating on the stock in a report on Wednesday, February 3rd. Oppenheimer reiterated a “buy” rating and issued a $45.00 price objective (down from $56.00) on shares of Sensata Technologies Holding in a report on Thursday, February 4th. SunTrust upgraded Sensata Technologies Holding from a “neutral” rating to a “buy” rating and set a $47.00 price objective on the stock in a report on Tuesday, March 29th. Finally, Atlantic Securities cut Sensata Technologies Holding from an “overweight” rating to a “neutral” rating in a research note on Thursday, February 4th. Eight investment analysts have rated the stock with a hold rating and seven have given a buy rating to the company. Sensata Technologies Holding currently has an average rating of “Hold” and an average price target of $47.18. Sensata Technologies Holding N.V. is a global industrial technology company. The Company is engaged in the development, manufacture and sale of sensors and controls. The Company’s operating segments include Sensors segment and Controls segment. The Company produce sensors and controls for applications such as thermal circuit breakers in aircraft, pressure sensors in automotive systems, and bimetal current and temperature control devices in electric motors. //www.americanbankingnews.com/2016/04/25/sensata-technologies-holdings-st-buy-rating-reaffirmed-at-bank-of-america/ Sensata Technologies Holding Sensata Technologies Holding
